title: 115_hr3450
content: The Act titled "Protecting Consumers from Unreasonable Rates Act" aims to protect consumers from excessive, unjustified, or unfairly discriminatory rates. The "Protecting Consumers from Unreasonable Rates Act" amends the Public Health Service Act to provide states with the authority to impose additional requirements on health insurance issuers regarding rate review standards and procedures to protect consumers. The Secretary consults with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners and consumer groups in the rate review process. The Secretary determines which markets in each state the State insurance commissioner or relevant State regulator will undertake corrective actions based on their utilization of such actions. The Secretary also determines in which markets they will undertake corrective actions. The Secretary, in cooperation with the State insurance commissioner or State regulator, will take corrective actions for excessive, unjustified, or unfairly discriminatory rates by denying or modifying rates as necessary. The Secretary, in cooperation with the State insurance commissioner or State regulator, will take corrective actions for excessive, unjustified, or unfairly discriminatory rates by denying, modifying rates, or requiring rebates to consumers. Noncompliance may result in civil monetary penalties and plan ineligibility. Regulatory authority is clarified to address potentially excessive, unjustified, or unfairly discriminatory rates. The text discusses addressing potentially excessive, unjustified, or unfairly discriminatory rates by modifying rates, denying them, or providing rebates to consumers. It also mentions civil monetary penalties and plan ineligibility for noncompliance. Title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include section 2723 with subsections (a) and (b) addressing modifications related to section 2794. In section 2761 of the Public Health Service Act, amendments include inserting references to section 2794 after certain phrases in subsections (a) and (b). In section 2761 of the Public Health Service Act, references to section 2794 are inserted in subsections (a) and (b) regarding health insurance coverage rates. Additionally, section 1251(a)(4)(A) of the Affordable Care Act is amended to include section 2794 in relation to rate reasonableness. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this Act. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and shall be implemented with respect to health plans beginning not later than January 1, 2018.
